intro: Pentapanax bellendenkeriensis, commonly known as the Bellendenker Island pentapanax, is a rare endemic plant native to the island of Bellendenker in Indonesia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with five leaflets, giving it the genus name "Pentapanax." The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, and it produces black, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species.
